required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of CSL Limited's Influenza Virus Vaccine in the Paediatric Population Aged >= 6 Months to < 18 Years
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IV, Open Label, Multi-Centre Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of CSL Limited's Influenza Virus Vaccine in a Paediatric Population Aged >= 6 Months to < 18 Years

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase IV, Open Label, Multi-Centre Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability Profile of CSL Limited's Influenza Virus Vaccine in a Paediatric Population Aged >= 6 Months to < 18 Years

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Local and Systemic Solicited Adverse Events, Cohort A (6 Months to Less Than 3 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Solicited Local Adverse Events: pain, redness, and swelling/induration. Solicited Systemic Adverse Events: fever, headache, myalgia, nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, loss of appetite, and irritability.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Local and Systemic Solicited Adverse Events, Cohort A (6 Months to Less Than 3 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Solicited Local Adverse Events: pain, redness, and swelling/induration. Solicited Systemic Adverse Events: fever, headache, myalgia, nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, loss of appetite, and irritability.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Local and Systemic Solicited Adverse Events, Cohort B (3 Years to Less Than 9 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Solicited Local Adverse Events: pain, redness, and swelling/induration. Solicited Systemic Adverse Events: fever, headache, myalgia, nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, and malaise.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Local and Systemic Solicited Adverse Events, Cohort B (3 Years to Less Than 9 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Solicited Local Adverse Events: pain, redness, and swelling/induration. Solicited Systemic Adverse Events: fever, headache, myalgia, nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, and malaise.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Local and Systemic Solicited Adverse Events, Cohort C (9 Years to Less Than 18 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Solicited Local Adverse Events: pain, redness, and swelling/induration. Solicited Systemic Adverse Events: fever, headache, myalgia, nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, and malaise.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Local and Systemic Solicited Adverse Events, Cohort C (9 Years to Less Than 18 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Solicited Local Adverse Events: pain, redness, and swelling/induration. Solicited Systemic Adverse Events: fever, headache, myalgia, nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, and malaise.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency and Intensity of Unsolicited Adverse Events (UAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: UAE stands for Unsolicited Adverse Event.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days after the last study vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of New Onsets of Chronic Illness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days after the last study vaccination

arm_group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years
Participants aged 3 years to less than 9 years
Participants aged 9 years to less than 18 years

overall_official.affiliation: Royal Children's Hospital, Brisbane, Herston, QLD, Australia

results_reference.citation: Lambert SB, Chuk LM, Nissen MD, Nolan TM, McVernon J, Booy R, Heron L, Richmond PC, Walls T, Marshall HS, Reynolds GJ, Hartel GF, Hu W, Lai MH. Safety and tolerability of a 2009 trivalent inactivated split-virion influenza vaccine in infants, children and adolescents. Influenza Other Respir Viruses. 2013 Sep;7(5):676-85. doi: 10.1111/irv.12107. Epub 2013 Apr 2.

group.title: Cohort A
group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years, who received one or two doses of the 2009 Southern Hemisphere formulation of CSL Limited Influenza Virus Vaccine.

group.title: Cohort B
group.description: Participants aged 3 to less than 9 years, who received one or two doses of the 2009 Southern Hemisphere formulation of CSL Limited Influenza Virus Vaccine.

group.title: Cohort C
group.description: Participants aged 9 to less than 18 years, who received one or two doses of the 2009 Southern Hemisphere formulation of CSL Limited Influenza Virus Vaccine.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Move away from the study area
Unable to attend the study visit

group.title: Cohort A
group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years, who received one or two doses of the 2009 Southern Hemisphere formulation of CSL Limited Influenza Virus Vaccine.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Frequency and Intensity of Local and Systemic Solicited Adverse Events, Cohort A (6 Months to Less Than 3 Years)
outcome.description: Solicited Local Adverse Events: pain, redness, and swelling/induration. Solicited Systemic Adverse Events: fever, headache, myalgia, nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, loss of appetite, and irritability.
outcome.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received CSL’s IVV and provided at least one safety assessment after vaccination. For the safety analysis of solicited AEs after the second vaccination, only those participants who received a second vaccination and provided safety follow-up after the second vaccination were included.

group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years

measure.population: The Safety Population comprised all participants who received CSL’s IVV and provided at least one safety assessment after vaccination. For the safety analysis of solicited AEs after the second vaccination, only those participants who received a second vaccination and provided safety follow-up after the second vaccination were included.

reported_events.time_frame: SAEs were collected up to 180 days after the last study vaccination. Other adverse events were unsolicited adverse events that were collected up to 30 days after the study vaccination.
reported_events.desc: Other adverse events were unsolicited adverse events that were collected up to 30 days after the study vaccination.

group.title: Cohort A
group.description: Participants aged 6 months to less than 3 years, who received one or two doses of the 2009 Southern Hemisphere formulation of CSL Limited Influenza Virus Vaccine.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
